intro: Volutaria leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered volutaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, feathery appearance, and its small, white flowers bloom in clusters. Volutaria leucantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
